data.name: SOWE
data.overview: {"ops":[{"insert":"SOWE is a Swedish/Ugandan non-profit organization dedicated to improve the living conditions for women and children in high poverty regions of the developing world. We believe that the most efficient way to achieve this is to support local initiatives that work through social, educative and financial women empowerment."},{"insert":"\n"},{"insert":"We use our income to:"},{"insert":"- Issue microloans with zero interest rate for women entrepreuners."},{"insert":"- Distribute school materials to kids in Mpigi."},{"insert":"- Give access to books, computers, internet and blockchain at our center that we share with Yamba Hearts for Uganda."},{"insert":"- Give UBI of 1 UST per day for teenage girls."},{"insert":"- Increase availability of sanitary products by giving away pads and menstrual cups."},{"insert":"- Help local entrepreneurs set up a pad making business."},{"insert":"\n"},{"insert":"SOWE strives to minimize all expenditures that is not directly beneficial to the society of Mpigi. We take no salaries. Excluding banking fees 100% of our income is given to the community in Uganda."},{"insert":"We value transparency above all, all we do is or will be made public."},{"insert":"We are democratically run by our members. Everyone who donates the equivalent of 300 SEK (30 EURO) will become a member of SOWE and hold equal voting rights on our annual meeting."},{"insert":"We are also launching SOWE DANO on Angel protocol to decentralize our organization and welcome more people to join us in our mission! :)"},

data.name: mothers2mothers
data.overview: {"ops":[{"insert":"mothers2mothers (m2m) is an African not-for-profit that unlocks the power of women to eliminate paediatric AIDS and create healthy families. m2m trains and employs women living with HIV in sub-Saharan Africa as frontline health workers. These “Mentor Mothers” become role models who help women and families at health facilities and in their communities access essential services and medical care, start on any treatment they need, and continue with their health journey. From an initial focus on preventing mother-to-child transmission of HIV, m2m now delivers a range of services for newborns, children, adolescents and families, to ensure the whole community thrives, not just survives. Mentor Mothers are armed with the knowledge of how it feels to be in their clients’ shoes and are trusted members of their community—a simple, but incredibly effective, model of sisterhood. Over the last 20 years, m2m has created jobs for over 11,000 women living with HIV in sub-Saharan Africa and, together, they have reached over 13.5M people with critical health services and education. In 2020, m2m reached over 1.3M people across 10 African nations, and achieved virtual elimination of mother-to-child transmission of HIV among its enrolled clients for the seventh year in a row. m2m also broadened its client base in 2020 in line with its commitment to increase access to healthcare for everyone—reaching 16% more children (ages 0-2), 31% more adolescents (ages 10-19), and 16% more young adults (ages 20-24), compared to 2019."}]}

data.name: Tibet Relief Fund
data.overview:
{"ops":[{"insert":"We serve Tibetans in exile via funding projects, directly and through a vibrant sponsorship program. Recently we have contributed to various C19 relief efforts, our sponsorship program ensure that over 100 children can get a Tibetan education, monk and nuns are able to study and Tibetan elders are able to live comfortably."},{"insert":"
"},{"insert":"Our mission "},{"insert":"
"},{"insert":"Tibet Relief Fund works to empower Tibetans to build sustainable communities and better futures through education and innovative practical grassroots initiatives."},{"insert":"
"},{"insert":"Our vision"},{"insert":"
"},{"insert":"A world where Tibetans can live and work with equality and security and celebrate their rich culture and traditions."},{"insert":"
"},{"insert":"Thanks for checking out our page on Angel Protocol. We are very excited to be here and to be involved with this innovative blockchain project."},{"insert":"
"},{"insert":"Read more: https://tibetrelieffund.co.uk/about-tibet-relief-fund/"},

data.name: End Poverty
data.overview: {"ops":[{"insert":"End Poverty is a civil society organization registered in 2009 with a purpose to contribute towards poverty reduction."},{"insert":"End Poverty main target segment are poor landless agricultural farmers, small and marginal farmers, traditional artisans, poor and needy women , uneducated girl child , unemployed  youth etc. Capacity building and training are the most important elements among others to support the diverse groups striving for change and a better life ."},

data.name: Regenerative Community Land Trust
data.overview:
{"ops":[{"insert":"RegenCLT establishes common ground for regenerative community development by weaving together ecological design, CLT governance and web3 technologies."},{"insert":"
"},{"insert":"Summary"},{"insert":"We work to reclaim and protect the commons by supporting the development of resilient place-based communities and a culture of regeneration.","type":"unordered-list-item"},{"insert":""The story of land is older than the story of man. Land came first; no man created it.Every society, large or small, must devise ways in which its members will share this gift. This is allocation. Members of the society must also determine under what conditions the land will be passed on to the next generation.This is continuity. And they must decide if, when, and how it may be traded with others. This is exchange." - Robert Swann"},{"insert":"
"},{"insert":"Our Focus"},{"insert":"Larger projects that combine the community land trust model of land tenure with regenerative agriculture, permaculture, natural building, rural development, good urbanism and web3 technology to support the resilient place-based communities of our future."},{"insert":"
"},{"insert":"Our Vision (maybe yours too)"},{"insert":"A global network of regenerative bioregional economies and place-based communities built on ecological design principles and resilient systems to support humanity as we transition into a new paradigm of abundance."},{"insert":"
"},{"insert":"Legal Status: We are a 501(c)3 nonprofit organization, and every bioregional node will be too. (or a similar structure depending on the country)"},{"insert":"
"},{"insert":"WHERE THE MONEY GOES"},{"insert":"Supporting the core functions and responsibilities of RegenCLT along with its team members and contributors","type":"unordered-list-item"},{"insert":"Fund the first mutli-stakeholder RegenCLT project","type":"unordered-list-item"},{"insert":"Co-create the web3 governance system to run in parallel to the ‘analog’ legal title-holding bioregional node","type":"unordered-list-item"},{"insert":"Collaborate with various stakeholders to make projects happen efficiently and that the work being done is truly regenerative.","type":"unordered-list-item"},{"insert":"🤝  Become a Member - RegenCLT.org"},{"insert":"
"},{"insert":"Thank you for your support 💚"},{"insert":"
"},

data.name: Yellow Boat of Hope Foundation
data.overview:
{"ops":[{"insert":"The Yellow Boat of Hope Foundation (formerly Philippine Funds for Little Kids) began from a single social media post, “wow…kids swim 2km to school!!!”, after being told and eventually witnessing the determination of the children in the mangrove village of Layag-Layag, Brgy. Talon-Talon, Zamboanga City to go to school."},{"insert":"
"},{"insert":"Aware of the dangers on their path to acquire education, these children tirelessly swim across bodies of water and walk several kilometers through sand and mud with the hope of someday changing the lives of their families into something better."},{"insert":"
"},{"insert":"As a response, we decided to start a fundraising effort and pooled our resources to fund the Yellow Boat Project to help these children get to school fast, safe, and dry."},{"insert":"
"},{"insert":"What we initially thought was a one-time project turned out to be our life-long mission."},{"insert":"
"},{"insert":"We believe that education is the only way and hope of these children and their families to escape poverty. If kids can keep going to school, things can change."},{"insert":"
"},{"insert":"With the help of our partners, Hope Paddlers, and volunteers, our Yellow Boat Project has snowballed into a much bigger advocacy to effect lasting changes and improvement to the lives of the communities."},{"insert":"
"},{"insert":"From one humble yellow boat with the words “Bagong Pag-Asa” (New Hope) imprinted on its body, we are now building classrooms, dormitories, bridges, and community learning centers;and also providing scholarships, school supplies, and medical and dental missions."},{"insert":"
"},{"insert":"We conduct feeding programs as well to make it easier for kids to stay in school, and livelihood projects to help parents sustain their kids’ education."},{"insert":"
"},{"insert":"Our Yellow Boat Project has sailed countless journeys, touched many lives, and continues to ferry thousands of children to school every day to pave a brighter future for them. Furthermore, we have created more initiatives to uplift the lives of entire communities. These are the Yellow School Boat Project, Adopt-a-Fisherman Project, Yellow School of Hope, Yellow Dorm of Hope, Yellow Boat ALS Karunungan, Yellow Boat Adventures, Yellow Bridge of Hope, Week Without Walls, Yellow Boat E-Hubs, and Seeds of Hope among others."},{"insert":"
"},{"insert":"Amazingly, with the help of the Almighty, our sponsors, and the unwavering volunteerism of our Hope Paddlers, we continue to bring “Bagong Pag-Asa” to where it is needed."},{"insert":"
"},{"insert":"We can get there faster if we all work together and help each other. No amount of donation or effort is too small to make a change… because it only takes one person who cares to make a difference."},{"insert":"
"},{"insert":"Come paddle with us until no kid is left behind… one Yellow Boat at a time. #HopeSails"},{"insert":"
"},{"insert":"PS - You can learn more about us by visiting https://www.yellowboat.org."},

data.name: Marine Megafauna Foundation
data.overview: {"ops":[{"insert":"The Marine Megafauna Foundation is saving ocean giants from extinction. We work around the world, from Florida in the USA to Flores in Indonesia, to protect endangered marine wildlife."}]}
